sen.j: 神馬（しんめ、あるいは、じんめ）は、日本の神社に奉納されたウマ、あるいは祭事の際に使用される馬を指す。
sen.e: Sacred horse is a term used to refer to a horse that is dedicated to a Japanese shrine or the one used at rites and festivals.
Shinme, or sacred horse, is a term used to refer to a horse that is dedicated to a Japanese shrine or one used in rites and festivals.
Shinme (or Jinme, sacred horse) is a term used to refer to a horse that is dedicated to a Japanese shrine or one used in rites and festivals.

sen.j: 馬の種類には特に決まりはなく、神が乗るとされる。
sen.e: There is no rule about the kinds of horses to be chosen, and it is considered that the gods ride them.
There is no rule about the kinds of horses to be chosen, and they are believed to be ridden by kami (deities, spirits).
There is no rule about the kinds of horses to be chosen, and they are believed to be ridden by god (deities, spirits).

sen.j: 奈良時代から祈願のために馬を奉納する習わしがある。
sen.e: Since the Nara period, it has been customary to dedicate horses to pray to god.
Since the Nara period, it has been customary to dedicate horses as a prayer to kami.
Since the Nara period, it has been customary to dedicate horses as a prayer to god.

sen.j: 奉納者は一般の民間人から皇族まで様々である。
sen.e: Dedicators vary from commoners to the imperial family members.
Dedicators range from ordinary people to members of the imperial family.

sen.j: 小規模な神社ではその世話などが重荷となること、また高価であり献納する側にとっても大きな負担となることから、絵馬などに置き換わっていった。
sen.e: Since caring for horses can be a burden for small shrines and horses are expensive for dedicators, Ema (a votive picture horse tablet) gradually replaced horses.
Since caring for horses can be a burden for small shrines and horses are expensive for dedicators, they were gradually replaced by 'ema' (wooden votive plaques, originally with a picture a horse).

sen.j: また、等身大の馬の像をもって神馬とすることも多い。
sen.e: In many cases, a life-size statue of horse is regarded as a Sacred horse.
In many cases, a life-size statue of horse is regarded as a shinme.
In many cases, a life-size statue of horse is regarded as a shinme.

sen.j: 延喜式3巻26条では、雨を願うときには黒毛の馬を、晴れを願うときには白毛馬をそれぞれ献納するという記述がある。
sen.e: In the article 26, volume 3 of the Enkishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), it is written that a black horse was dedicated when people prayed for rain and a white horse was dedicated when they prayed for fair weather.

sen.j: また、祭りなどにおいて多量の馬を使用する場合もあり、一時的に神馬と呼ぶ場合もある。
sen.e: Occasionally, when many horses are used at festivals and other events, they are temporarily called sacred horses.
Occasionally, when many horses are used at festivals and other events, they are temporarily called shinme.
